All materials needed for this course are available for free online and through the course Moodle.



## DataCamp

![](`r list.files(path = here::here(), pattern = "DataCamp-Horizontal-RGB.png", recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE)[1]`)

We'll be using <a href="https://datacamp.com">DataCamp</a> for some of our training in R.  See the course Moodle page for the invite link to gain free access to the DataCamp materials we'll use.


## Software

Downloading and installation of the course software will be covered during the first week of class.



### R and RStudio

We'll use the free and open-source R programming language.  You can download an appropriate version of R here: https://cran.r-project.org/

We'll use the RStudio Integrated Development Environment (IDE) to edit and run our R code.  Download RStudio here: https://rstudio.com/



### Other Software

In addition, you'll need word processing software, as well as software that can easily display comman separated values (CSV) files.  

All UMass students are eligible for a free license of Microsoft Office 365, a suite of programs inclulding Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.  Visit the Information Technology page for more info: https://www.umass.edu/it/software/microsoft-office-365-education

You may also use browser-based software such as Google Docs.  Your UMass Box account gives you access to browser-based versions of Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.


## Other materials

Additional readings, online resources, and other materials will be introduced as needed.
